content.title: Collaborative Research Scheme (CRS)
content.beneficiary: TEQIP faculties in Technical Education institutes
content.details: Launched by the All India Council for Technical Education, Collaborative Research Scheme (CRS) aims to provide financial support in the form of research grants to the young TEQIP faculties recruited in different Technical Education Quality Improvement Programme (TEQIP) institutes so as to collaborate for research and build research community.
benefits: Funding is divided into Recurring (40%) and Non-Recurring (60%)
Support for collaboration among TEQIP faculties
eligibility: The proposal should be submitted by a group of faculties, one is Principal Investigator (PI) from different TEQIP institutions and other are Co-Principal Investigators (Co-PIs) from TEQIP or Non TEQIP Institution.
The group shall consist of at least 3 faculty.
One TEQIP-faculty should be from Host Institute who will be a Principal Investigator (PI).
Maximum Two proposals can be submitted by one PI.
content.application_process: Online application process through the AICTE portal.
documents_required: Mandate form signed by Head of the Institution and bank authority
Certificate of collaboration signed by PI, Co-PIs, and Head of the Institution
Bio-data of all the PI & Co-PIs
Brief of Research Proposal (not more than 500 words)

faqs.question: What is Collaborative Research Scheme (CRS)?
faqs.answer: Collaborative Research Scheme (CRS) To support innovation & research across institutes with collaboration among TEQIP Faculty, Regular faculty of Project institutions (focus and non-focus) & Premier institutions of the country.

faqs.question: Who manages this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

faqs.question: Who can submit proposal under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The proposal should be submitted by a group of faculties, one is Principal Investigator (PI) from different TEQIP institutions and other are Co-Principal Investigators (Co-PIs) from TEQIP or Non TEQIP Institution.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the Project?
faqs.answer: Duration of the project will be of One year from the date of receipt of funds in the institute’s account.
